episode_summary: This episode features discussions on the first computer to discover a shape and its appearances in TV shows, the origins of the trolley problem and its philosophical implications, the challenges faced during the first road trip across America, and a board game that accidentally included a fictional character created by a New Zealand farmer.

facts.fact: The first computer to ever discover a shape starred in an episode of the 1980s sitcom Laverne and Shirley.
The woman who invented the trolley problem was the daughter of a man who made railway tracks for a living.
On the first ever road trip across America, multiple bridges collapsed under the weight of the cars and had to be rebuilt along the way.
In the board game Rising Sun, players are able to collect monsters that are inspired by both Japanese mythology and, by complete accident, a New Zealand farmer.
